justification: The article notes that Shu et al. (2011) “scored higher on a Moral Disengagement questionnaire,” showing that the construct of moral disengagement was operationalised with that questionnaire.

measured_by: Matrix problem-solving task with self-reported score
justification: Cheating was assessed when “people…over-report[ed] how many matrices they had solved,” indicating that the matrix task served as the behavioral measure of cheating.

A paradigm is described in which “participants see pairs of texts and decide whether the texts are similar enough to constitute plagiarism,” making these judgements the measure of plagiarism perception.
The Zhao et al. (2017) study measured cheating when children “peeked at the hidden card” during a guessing game, using that task to assess their likelihood of cheating.
